comment: Good teacher, accent or language barrier made it interesting at times but overall good teacher and I would recommend her for Math 1111 to anyone.

I loved this professor she was very kind. Maybe I am just bad at math so I struggled a little. There is 2 homework assignments each week. She responds fast to emails and answers any questions you have. You will get an A if you stay on top of the HW because it will add up and ask questions when you have them

The Aleks assignments can be frustrating but Prof. Aktas is amazing! She truly wants everyone to pass and will answer every single question. She offers occasional extra credit. She makes a review guide and are basically the same as the tests. She makes it as easy as possible. take her!

Professor Aktas is amazing! She explains concepts very well and works out examples while explaining the concepts. If you struggle with math or you're a visual learner I'd say take this professor. The only criticisms are later in the course she leaves out small steps from her examples because she expects you to already know them and she moves fast.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Shes really nice. The tests are exactly like the study guides with different numbers. We used Aleks for hw.

Attendance is 6 percent of your grade so if you do not want to show up it's fine, and she only takes a attendance a couple times throughout the semester. She was amazing. The study guide is exactly like the test just different numbers. Her exams are not too hard. She cares. I loved her as a teacher you should take her.
Best math teacher ever.

Wish I could take her next year for precalc. She explains some things better than others but really wants you to succeed. Extra credit sometimes if you answer a question correctly in class. ALEKS will take up a lot of your time. Her tests are similar to the reviews ;). Notecard on every exam! Just review the notes and do HW, you will be fine.

If you do her study guides and do the homework in ALEKS you will get an A I promise!! She is super nice, even sometimes let us take the notes home ourselves. She is a very sweet woman. She will help you after class if you are too shy to speak up. Dropped lowest exam and lowest participation grade. I will probably take her in the future.

Always available for extra help if needed. Most work can be self-taught on ALEKS if you miss any days. Tests are the reviews, but they are different numbers, and she explains in simple terms. Makes sure everyone understands and has their questions answered before continuing the lecture. Only thing is she takes attendance and that is for a grade.

Im horrible in math and I received an A. The tests are just like the reviews. I barely studied. She's super nice and will go over a variety of ways to solve one problem is very thorough. She does not like phones being used in class which is understandable. I would 100% take her.

I suck at math, BUT she is the best math professor you could ask for. She made math feel easy for once. She goes slowly over notes and gives you every opportunity to ask questions. She wants you to succeed. Her study guides are very, very similar to the tests (same wording, different numbers). ALEKS HW is annoying but doable.She is the best prof.

I loved professor Aktas. She gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit during lecture. Attendance is not mandatory but she does do spontaneous participation grade, Test were no more than 15 questions and really similar to the review. She does a review lecture prior to the exam and the Aleks modules help to understand the material better.

Prof Atkas is a very nice lady, and made precalculus bearable. She gives you the most chances to ask her questions or to re-explain, and she is very patient. Attendance is not technically mandatory, but I would of course recommend going, and she will sporadically check for participation points (but they only make up 6% of your grade)

Professor Aktas is a very sweet and caring woman. The ALEKS homework was the most annoying thing and can be trying. The content isn't necessarily hard, but I struggled personally with her teaching style but exams are super easy, thank goodness. They are formatted exactly like the test reviews so if you study that, you will do well on the tests.

An amazing professor and gives you so many opportunities to complete missed work, dropped your lowest out of each category and your final can replace your lowest test grade. She does take attendance and it is 6% of your grade so beware.
Amazing class, just no phones

Professor Aktas cares so much about her students, which makes ALL the difference when searching for a math professor. Some of the units were pretty difficult, but she can be lenient and will give you an extension if needed. Had a family emergency and had to miss a lot of class and she went out of her way to help me get caught up. Would take again!

Professor Aktas is a very kind teacher and is great at explaining things if you aren't great with math. She has a slight accent, but it hardly makes a difference when understanding her. She's very sweet and will work with you if you ever need help or miss something like a test. The class wasn't super easy for me, but she helped me a lot.

She was a good professor. She would also go for the little thing if you are confused what she used and how she has done it. The only reason why I had a low grade in her class it was due to my lack of attendance. But if you pay attention she would help you.

Great math teacher. She teaches the material so well; as long as you show up to her class, take notes, and do the homework, then you will definitely pass her class with an A. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she sometimes does a participation grade for students who show up. Also, don't be on your phone in her class. She really does not like it, lol.

This class is really easy if you show up. She goes through everything that you need to know for the final at the end of the semester. For tests, she goes over the whole review with the class and the actual tests are the same layout as the review. Also she lets you do a front and back cheatsheet on a notecard. She made the class easy to pass.

Loved her. She genuinely cared about her students and it's hard to not get an A unless you show like little to no effort. The grading was clear and concise and the tests were very similar to the study guide.

The only things you need to do to pass Professor Aktas class is study, ask questions, stay off your phone, and do your ALEKS. Genuinely she makes it beyond easy to pass. She is super caring and helpful and will answer any questions kindly. The only complaint I ever heard about her was her accent which is easy to understand.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Best math teacher I've taken, actually wants all her students to succeed with good grades which is rare. Make sure to participate, I earned extra points doing so. Tests are straightforward if you come to lectures

She's a great professor to have and she wants everyone to understand the material. She's also very nice for answering questions and attendance isn't mandatory. Her tests are similar from the reviews she makes and not too difficult, so just study and practice.

Took for precalc. She is very intricate on the material and makes sure everyone understands the material. Really good for students who struggle with math. Her study guides are exactly like the exam so no surprises. No phones allowed in class but it honestly helped me pay attention. Sometimes she'll give bonus points on the exam for participation.

Greatest professor I have ever had! She really cares about the class and is willing to spend time on explaining your questions until you all get it. She is also eager to work with you outside of class. Her tests mostly come from the reviews and aren't much difficult. I would definitely take her again!

Great professor, really cares about the class. I had her for pre calc and she really goes in depth. Very nice on answering questions. She really wants everyone to understand the subject. And she gives extra credit in class. Attendance not mendatory but I recomand to go to class bc its very helpful.

Her class is lecture heavy and has lots of writing as there are no papers given out to do. Attendance is not mandatory, but if you do not show up you will miss participation points and the notes since it's not posted online. I highly recommend the Aleks work.She generally does care about your grade and checks that you understand the material.
